page.title: 18Local History
page.content: There is a tree in St.Mary's Churchyard, said to be a thousand years old. It has supplied bows and arrows for English archers at the Battle of Agincourt. This yew is said to have been struck by lightning. A feature of the churchyard which usually arouses the curiosity of newcomers is the tall, stone, hut shaped edifice (standing to the east of the yew tree).It was called the 'Watcher's Box'.Those who kept their vigil there had been posted there to prevent or frustrate the ghoulish activities of the body-snatchers. According to old newspaper reports dated l824,gangs of body-snatchers made persistent raids on the churchyard in the middle of the night. It was said that they had a ready market for their melancholy loot amongst the young medical students.
